title.rendered: 5 Great Benefits of Adding an Island in Your Vaughan Kitchen

content.rendered:
If you plan to remodel your kitchen to make it more functional or add value to your home, you need to think about which features you want. New countertops and appliances may be at the top of your list along with a stylish backsplash, but you shouldn’t underestimate the benefits of adding an island to your cooking space. Here are five reasons you should include a kitchen island in your renovation.

1. Increase Storage

Your kitchen is one of the most frequently used spaces in your home, so it’s no surprise that you need plenty of storage space for pots, pans, dishes and cooking utensils. One of the biggest benefits of a kitchen island is that it adds storage space to your kitchen. Whether you want to hide your cooking supplies behind cabinets or display them on open shelving, a kitchen island is the perfect solution.

2. Add Seating Space

Kitchen islands aren’t just for storage. If you entertain guests frequently or have a large family, consider placing barstools at your island to increase your seating space. You can move the seats out of the way when they aren’t in use to enhance convenience. This option gives you plenty of room to seat guests comfortably even when your kitchen is not huge.

3. Improve Home Value

Home upgrades are often expensive, but they raise the value of your home so you can fetch a decent price if you ever decide to sell. Many potential homebuyers love having kitchen islands to improve the functionality of the space. Upgrading your kitchen with an island is a great way to raise the value of your house so you can get the most out of your investment if you ever decide to put your home on the market.

4. Give Versatility

If you invest in a portable kitchen island, you have the option to move it around your kitchen as needed. Move it to the side when multiple chefs are trying to use the stove, or use the island as a preparation station for chopping. The options are endless, but being able to move the island is invaluable when it comes to cooking in small kitchen spaces.

5. Make Space for More Appliances

Limited counter space is a chief complaint in many kitchens. When you don’t have much counter space, you won’t have much room for preparing food. You also may not have space for many appliances that make cooking easier. When you only have space for a sink, stove and dishwasher, you need plenty of storage space for smaller appliances because you don’t have room to display them on the counter. Installing a kitchen island solves this problem by giving you much more space for all of your cooking appliances.

How To Make a Kitchen Renovation With an Island

Renovating your kitchen is an extensive project, and if you want to install an island, it’s best to leave the task to a professional. Handyman Connection specializes in remodelling services in Vaughan, so if you want an experienced professional overseeing island installation, call us for help. All of our craftsmen have exquisite attention to detail so we can make all of your kitchen dreams come true. Not only are our services affordable, but we also clean up thoroughly after a job and never leave until you are satisfied with the result.
